turns.content: write out a 4 week workout program for 3x per week in which each week will alternate from upper body to lower to upper and then to lower body, upper and then lower. Repeat alternating. Have each workout use 3 sets of 15 reps. each lower body workout should alternate from hip to knee dominant movements and should account for posterior and anterior chain collectively. Use as many compound exercises (multi-joint movements) as possible. For upper body, stick to the same rep scheme, and keep as many compound movements as possible. try and stick to exercises that are freeweight more than machines.

Sure! Here is a 4-week workout program that alternates between upper and lower body workouts and focuses on compound exercises:

Week 1:

Monday: Upper Body

* Bench Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Pull-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Shoulder Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Tricep Dips (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Bicep Curls (3 sets of 15 reps)

Wednesday: Lower Body

* Squats (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Lunges (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Step-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Calf Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)

Friday: Upper Body

* Incline Bench Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Row (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Push-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Tricep Extension (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Hammer Curls (3 sets of 15 reps)

Week 2:

Monday: Lower Body

* Deadlifts (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Leg Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Lunges (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Calf Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)

Wednesday: Upper Body

* Bench Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Pull-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Shoulder Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Tricep Dips (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Bicep Curls (3 sets of 15 reps)

Friday: Lower Body

* Squats (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Leg Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Step-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Calf Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)

Week 3:

Monday: Upper Body

* Incline Bench Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Row (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Push-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Tricep Extension (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Hammer Curls (3 sets of 15 reps)

Wednesday: Lower Body

* Deadlifts (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Leg Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Lunges (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Calf Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)

Friday: Upper Body

* Bench Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Pull-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Shoulder Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Tricep Dips (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Bicep Curls (3 sets of 15 reps)

Week 4:

Monday: Lower Body

* Squats (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Leg Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Step-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Calf Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)

Wednesday: Upper Body

Friday: Lower Body

that's perfect. rewrite it, but with around 6-7 exercises per workout and add in a few sculpting style movements such as lateral raises, single leg toe touch squats and glute raises, etc.

Sure! Here is a revised 4-week workout program that includes 6-7 exercises per workout and includes some sculpting style movements:

Week 1:

Monday: Upper Body

* Bench Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Pull-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Shoulder Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Tricep Dips (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Bicep Curls (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Lateral Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Push-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)

Wednesday: Lower Body

* Squats (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Lunges (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Step-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Calf Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Single Leg Toe Touch Squats (3 sets of 15 reps per leg)
* Glute Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)

Friday: Upper Body

* Incline Bench Press (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Row (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Push-ups (3 sets of 15 reps)
* Tricep Extension (3 sets of 15 reps)
